unnormalised: Hey guys! It's exam season, and I know the struggle is real. Late-night study sessions, endless cups of chai, and the constant fear of forgetting everything â€“ been there, done that! But don't panic, because thanks to Education Technology, we've got a secret weapon: exam prep apps!

unnormalised: Forget lugging around heavy textbooks like those history books Uncle Rajesh keeps recommending. These apps are basically your personal tuition sir, right in your pocket.

unnormalised: First up, we've got **GradeUp** (now BYJU'S Exam Prep). This oneâ€™s popular for a reason. They've got mock tests for everything from JEE to UPSC. You can even find some free content!

unnormalised: Then there's **Testbook**. Their interface is super user-friendly, and they cover a wide range of government exams, like SSC CGL. Plus, they often have amazing deals, especially around festivals like Diwali! Think you can crack the IBPS PO exam with their help? Challenge accepted!

Plus, they often have amazing deals, especially around festivals like Diwali! Think you can crack the I B P S P O exam with their help? Challenge accepted!

unnormalised: And don't forget **Embibe**. Itâ€™s got this cool AI-powered learning thing that analyzes your weaknesses and recommends personalized study plans. It's like having your own Dronacharya guiding you through the syllabus.

unnormalised: Pro tip: Use these apps strategically. Don't just passively scroll through content. Actively take notes, attempt practice questions, and track your progress.
normalised: Pro tip: Use these apps strategically. Don't just passively scroll through content. Actively take notes, attempt practice questions, and track your progress.

unnormalised: Also, remember to take breaks! Overloading your brain won't help. Go outside, breathe some fresh air, and maybe even treat yourself to a plate of delicious biryani â€“ you deserve it! Onam Sadhya is also a great idea!

unnormalised: These apps offer flexibility. Stuck on a concept while travelling from Delhi to Mumbai? No worries, just whip out your phone and get studying. Need to revise formulas while waiting for your train at Howrah Station? Bam! Youâ€™re set.
